concept.deftn: The nature or the genre of the resource being entered.

outline.deftn: a self-contained composition on a fairly narrow topic or subject, written by one or more authors and published or submitted for publication in a magazine
a self-contained composition on a fairly narrow topic or subject, written by one or more authors and published or submitted for publication in a journal
a self-contained composition on a fairly narrow topic or subject, written by one or more authors and published or submitted for publication in a newsletter
a written work or composition that has been published and bound as a single volume
one of two or more major divisions of a book, each complete in itself but related in theme or structure to the division preceding and/or following it
an evaluative account of a book, usually written by a qualified person for publication in a newspaper, magazine, or journal
a book or numbered set of books containing authoritative summary information about a variety of topics in the form of short essays, usually arranged alphabetically
a topical division of an encyclopedia that provides an authoritative and summative explication of a given subject
a single visual representation
materials designed to respond to input from a human being, usually in the form of commands, data and/or actions
a book used as a reference in the operation of a task, computer program, procedure, job or other function
a written and, traditionally, unpublished work or composition
a technical note written by one or more NCAR employees

a serial publication consisting of no more than a few pages, devoted to news, announcements, and current information that is of interest primarily to a specialized group of subscribers or members of an association or organization
a visual medium created to publicize a forthcoming event or communicate scholarly or scientific work, with or without illustration
a broadcast, podcast, or formal representation of ideas communicated in person or via the Internet

a self-contained prose composition on a fairly narrow topic or subject, written by one or more authors and published as part of the record of a conference, congress, symposium, or other meeting sponsored by a society or association
a record of research findings, research still in progress, or other technical findings
a computer program, application, or model that must be run on a computer server
short, focused essays or supplementary documentation related to disciplinarily-specific research or field work
a specification that defines the properties and values of a metadata format

bestPractices.practice: This is an required field that uses a drop-down menu.
If the resource type is not listed, please contact opensky@ucar.edu.
